content: Planning Area in the Central Region of SingaporePlanning Area in Central Region, Singapore **Novena** ([IPA](/wiki/International_Phonetic_Alphabet): /noʊˈviːnə, -nɑː/ *noh-VEE-nə*) is a [planning area](/wiki/Planning_Areas_of_Singapore) located within the [Central Region](/wiki/Central_Region,_Singapore) of Singapore. Novena is bounded by [Toa Payoh](/wiki/Toa_Payoh) to the north, [Bukit Timah](/wiki/Bukit_Timah) to the west, [Tanglin](/wiki/Tanglin) to the south and [Kallang](/wiki/Kallang) to the east. It comprises five subzones, namely [Balestier](/wiki/Balestier), Dunearn, Malcolm, Mount Pleasant and Moulmein. While Novena is not classified as a "new town" by the [Housing and Development Board](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board) (HDB), the estate of [Whampoa](/wiki/Whampoa,_Singapore) within the subzone of [Balestier](/wiki/Balestier) constitutes part of the [Kallang](/wiki/Kallang)/Whampoa New Town. The vicinity is named after the [Novena](/wiki/Novena) prayer devotions to [Our Mother of Perpetual Help](/wiki/Our_Mother_of_Perpetual_Help), originally established by the [Redemptorist Order](/wiki/Redemptorist_Order) that settled and propagated within the area. In later years, the [Tan Tock Seng Hospital](/wiki/Tan_Tock_Seng_Hospital) was set in 1844, one of the oldest and busiest [hospitals](/wiki/Hospitals) in Singapore. ## Etymology Novena and its associated roads, buildings and [Mass Rapid Transit](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)) station are named after [Novena Church](/wiki/Novena_Church) (canonically the Church of Saint Alphonsus Liguori) located in the area. Balestier Road was named after [Joseph Balestier](/wiki/Joseph_Balestier), an American diplomat who served in Singapore in the 1800s. ## Infrastructure ### Housing Land in Novena is very expensive because of its close proximity to the [Central Area](/wiki/Central_Area,_Singapore). There are few [HDB](/wiki/Housing_Development_Board) flats in Novena; most houses in the area are condominiums or private housing. ### Healthcare Novena is home to the largest concentration of hospitals and medical centres in Singapore. An integrated academic medical complex termed [HealthCity Novena](/wiki/HealthCity_Novena), is centred around [Tan Tock Seng Hospital](/wiki/Tan_Tock_Seng_Hospital), and supported by step-down facilities such as the Integrated Care Hub, [Ren Ci Hospital](/wiki/Ren_Ci_Hospital) and Dover Park Hospice as well tertiary national medical centres including the [National Centre for Infectious Diseases](/wiki/National_Centre_for_Infectious_Diseases), [National Neuroscience Institute](/wiki/National_Neuroscience_Institute) and [National Skin Centre](/wiki/National_Skin_Centre). The Clinical Sciences Building of the [Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine](/wiki/Lee_Kong_Chian_School_of_Medicine) and various leisure and public spaces complete the complex. A number of private healthcare providers are situated next to Tan Tock Seng Hospital. The private cluster is anchored by [Mount Elizabeth Novena Hospital](/wiki/Mount_Elizabeth_Novena_Hospital), with standalone outpatient clinics leveraging on [network effects](/wiki/Network_effect) setting up in Novena Medical Centre, Novena Specialist Centre and Royal Square Novena. ### Commercial Central to this area is [Novena Square](/wiki/Novena_Square), a mixed used development situated directly above the [Novena MRT station](/wiki/Novena_MRT_station). Novena Medical Centre is located at levels 8 to 11 of the [Square 2](/wiki/Square_2) shopping centre. Adjacent to Novena Square's Office Tower is a sports-themed mall called Novena Velocity. Opposite Novena Square, and across the Junction of Newton Road, Moulmein Road and Thomson Road, is [United Square Shopping Mall](/wiki/United_Square_Shopping_Mall), a children-oriented mall, with shops catering to infants, kids and parents. Shops located in the Novena area include [Starbucks](/wiki/Starbucks) (one in United Square and another in Novena Square), [Cold Storage](/wiki/Cold_Storage_(supermarket)), [Decathlon](/wiki/Decathlon_(retailer)) and the newly opened [Don Don Donki](/wiki/Don_Don_Donki) at [Square 2](/wiki/Square_2), a Japanese Discount Store. Banks located in the Novena area include [POSB](/wiki/POSB_Bank) and [UOB](/wiki/United_Overseas_Bank). Novena has seen major improvements in terms of new shops opening in the area since Square 2 and Velocity commenced business in recent years. #### Novena Square **Velocity@Novena Square**, formerly known as Novena Square, is a sports and lifestyle [mall](/wiki/Shopping_mall) with a new building extension. It lies directly above [Novena MRT station](/wiki/Novena_MRT_station). It was opened in December 2000, and owned by Novena Square Investments. There are 160 stores and spans 3 floors. #### Square 2 **Square 2** is located at the [Novena MRT station](/wiki/Novena_MRT_station). It was opened on 10 December 2007, and it is developed and owned by [Far East Organization](/wiki/Far_East_Organization). It has over 180 specialty stores, selling food and beverage, fashion and accessories, [education](/wiki/Education) and enrichment, as well as beauty & wellness services, spanning five floors. ## Education Novena has a total of three primary schools, three secondary schools, three private schools and two schools offering tertiary education as of 2024. The list is as follows: ### Primary schools - Anglo-Chinese School (Primary) - St. Joseph's Institution Junior - [Singapore Chinese Girls' School](/wiki/Singapore_Chinese_Girls%27_School) (Primary school section) ### Secondary schools - [Anglo-Chinese School (Barker Road)](/wiki/Anglo-Chinese_School_(Barker_Road)) - [St. Joseph's Institution](/wiki/St._Joseph%27s_Institution,_Singapore) - [Singapore Chinese Girls' School](/wiki/Singapore_Chinese_Girls%27_School) (Secondary school section) ### Tertiary institutions - [Catholic Junior College](/wiki/Catholic_Junior_College) - St. Joseph's Institution (Junior College section) ### Other schools - Beacon International College - East Asia Institute of Management - [San Yu Adventist School](/wiki/San_Yu_Adventist_School) ## Transportation Novena is accessible by [MRT](/wiki/Novena_MRT_station), with buses serving the city, nearest neighbouring estates and is close proximity to the expressway. The area has no bus interchange, the nearest being in [Toa Payoh](/wiki/Toa_Payoh_Bus_Interchange). However, [Saint Michael's Bus Terminal](/wiki/List_of_bus_stations_in_Singapore#Saint_Michael's_Bus_Terminal) can be found along Balestier. - [Balestier Road](/wiki/Balestier_Road) - [144 Moulmein Road](/wiki/144_Moulmein_Road) - [Farrer Park](/wiki/Farrer_Park) - [Whampoa](/wiki/Whampoa,_Singapore) - Official website
